objectives.name: Primary Objective
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin is superior to placebo, when added to standard of care, in reducing the incidence of CV death or a HF event (hospitalisation for HF or equivalent HF event, i.e., an urgent HF visit).

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 1
objectives.text: To compare the effect of dapagliflozin versus placebo on CV death or hospitalisation for HF.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 2
objectives.text: To compare the effect of dapagliflozin versus placebo on total number of recurrent HF hospitalisations and CV death.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 3
objectives.text: To compare the effect of treatment with dapagliflozin versus placebo on the Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ) total symptom score for HF symptoms and physical limitations.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 4
objectives.text: To determine if dapagliflozin compared with placebo reduces the incidence of a composite endpoint of worsening renal function.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 5
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin, compared with placebo, reduces the incidence of all-cause mortality.

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of dapagliflozin in this patient population.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 1
objectives.text: To compare the effect of dapagliflozin versus placebo on an expanded composite outcome reflecting worsening of HF.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 2
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin compared with placebo will have effect on New York Heart Association (NYHA) class.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 3
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin compared with placebo will reduce the incidence of diagnosis of atrial fibrillation (AF) in patients without history of AF at baseline.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 4
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin compared with placebo will result in a reduction of the incidence of hyper – and hypokalaemia.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 5
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin compared with placebo will affect the number of events of doubling of serum creatinine.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 6
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin compared with placebo will reduce the incidence of diagnosis of T2D in patients without diabetes at baseline.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 7
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin compared with placebo will have effect on HbA1c in T2D subgroup.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 8
objectives.text: To determine whether dapagliflozin compared with placebo will have an effect on systolic BP.

endpoints.name: Primary Outcome Measure
endpoints.text: Time to the first occurrence of any of the components of this composite: 1. CV death 2. Hospitalisation for HF 3. An urgent HF visit

endpoints.name: Secondary Outcome Measure 1
endpoints.text: Time to the first occurrence of either of the components of this composite: 1. CV death 2. Hospitalisation for HF

endpoints.name: Secondary Outcome Measure 2
endpoints.text: Total number of (first and recurrent) HF hospitalisations and CV death.

endpoints.name: Secondary Outcome Measure 3
endpoints.text: Change from baseline measured at 8 months in the total symptom score of the KCCQ, a specific HF patient reported outcome questionnaire.

endpoints.name: Secondary Outcome Measure 4
endpoints.text: Time to the first occurrence of any of the components of this composite: 1. ≥50% sustained* decline in eGFR 2. Reaching End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) 3. Renal death

endpoints.name: Secondary Outcome Measure 5
endpoints.text: Time to death from any cause.

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measure 1
endpoints.text: Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measure 2
endpoints.text: Discontinuation of IP due to Adverse Events (DAEs)

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measure 3
endpoints.text: Changes in clinical chemistry/haematology parameters

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measure 4
endpoints.text: AEs of interest (volume depletion, renal events, major hypoglycaemic events, fractures, Diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA), AEs leading to amputation and AEs leading to a risk for lower limb amputations [“preceding events”])

endpoints.name: Exploratory Outcome Measure 1
endpoints.text: Time to the first occurrence of any of the components of the expanded composite worsening HF outcome: 1. CV death 2. Hospitalisation for HF 3. An urgent HF visit 4. Documented evidence of worsening HF symptoms/signs leading to initiation of a new treatment for HF sustained for at least 4 weeks or augmentation of existing oral therapy for HF (eg, increase in dose of diuretic) sustained for at least 4 weeks.

endpoints.name: Exploratory Outcome Measure 2
endpoints.text: Change in NYHA class from baseline.

endpoints.name: Exploratory Outcome Measure 3
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients without history of AF at baseline with a new diagnosis of AF during the study.

endpoints.name: Exploratory Outcome Measure 4
endpoints.text: Time to the first occurrence of each of any of the following central lab levels of serum potassium: >6.0 mmol/L, >5.5 mmol/L, <3.5 mmol/L, <3.0 mmol/L

endpoints.name: Exploratory Outcome Measure 5
endpoints.text: Number of events with doubling of serum creatinine (compared with the most recent laboratory measurement).

endpoints.name: Exploratory Outcome Measure 6
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients without T2D at baseline with a new diagnosis of T2D during the study.

endpoints.name: Exploratory Outcome Measure 7
endpoints.text: Changes in HbA1c from baseline.

endpoints.name: Exploratory Outcome Measure 8
endpoints.text: Change in systolic BP from baseline.
